Class TransactionReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • TransactionReader

  • public class TransactionReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class parses the transaction file. It calls the appropriate method to handle each transaction record.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TransactionReader(java.io.File file)
      This constructor instantiates two HashMaps; one to store the names of warehouses along with their inventory, and another one to store the UPC along with the FoodItem.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void readAllTransactions()
      Reads the transaction file and calls the appropriate method.
      void readEnd(java.lang.String line)
      Reads the end of transaction records.
      void readFoodItem(java.lang.String line)
      Reads and parses the food item record.
      void readNextDay(java.lang.String line)
      Reads and parses the next day record and advances the current day by one day.
      void readReceive(java.lang.String line)
      Reads and parses the receive food item record.
      void readRequest(java.lang.String line)
      Reads and parses the request food item record.
      void readStartDate(java.lang.String line)
      Reads and parses the start date record and creates a GergorianCalendar object representing the start date.
      void readWarehouse(java.lang.String line)
      Reads and parses the warehouse record.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransactionReader

        public TransactionReader(java.io.File file)
                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This constructor instantiates two HashMaps; one to store the names of warehouses along with their inventory, and another one to store the UPC along with the FoodItem.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

    • Method Detail

      • readAllTransactions

        public void readAllTransactions()
        Reads the transaction file and calls the appropriate method.

      • readFoodItem

        public void readFoodItem(java.lang.String line)
        Reads and parses the food item record. Add code in this method to store the UPC code along with the FoodItem.

      • readWarehouse

        public void readWarehouse(java.lang.String line)
        Reads and parses the warehouse record. Add code in this method to store the warehouse name and a new Inventory object.

      • readStartDate

        public void readStartDate(java.lang.String line)
        Reads and parses the start date record and creates a GergorianCalendar object representing the start date.

      • readReceive

        public void readReceive(java.lang.String line)
        Reads and parses the receive food item record. Add code in this method to add food items to the inventory. Use the Inventory.addItem(I, java.util.GregorianCalendar, int) method.

      • readRequest

        public void readRequest(java.lang.String line)
        Reads and parses the request food item record. Add code in this method to remove food items from inventory. Remember to remove oldest items first that have not already expired. Use the Inventory.removeItem(I, java.util.GregorianCalendar, int) method.

      • readNextDay

        public void readNextDay(java.lang.String line)
        Reads and parses the next day record and advances the current day by one day.

      • readEnd

        public void readEnd(java.lang.String line)
        Reads the end of transaction records.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
